get.description:
In most cases, this endpoint returns a single asset regardless of whether you filter by asset ID or token contract address.
However, since the system supports multiple chains, the same token contract address might exist on different chains,
potentially resulting in multiple assets being returned when filtering by token contract address.

This endpoint retrieves the balance of a specific asset on the chain.
If the asset id not provided, the balance of all assets will be returned.

asks.description:
Asks are sorted in ascending order by price.
<remarks>
In each list, the first element is the price and the second element is the volume.
</remarks>

bids.description:
Bids are sorted in descending order by price.
<remarks>
In each list, the first element is the price and the second element is the volume.
</remarks>

feeRate.description: The rate used to calculate withdrawal fees

rateDecimal.description: The decimal precision for the fee rate

minFee.description: The minimum fee amount that will be charged for withdrawals

Ex3.Exchange.OpenApi.AppServices.ChainIn.description: chain information which is supported by the system

contractAddress.description: address of smart contract. e.g., eth address for erc20, ticker for krc20

isBaseToken.description: the asset can be used only used as base token if true

contractAddress.description: address of smart contract. e.g., eth address for erc20, ticker for krc20

timestamp.description: the current timestamp in milliseconds since the Unix epoch.
